snippet: Everton Wagstaffe and Reginald Connor, convicted of a 1992 kidnapping, learned that their convictions were overturned by a panel of New York State appeals court judges.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column; convictions are overturned by New York State appeals court for Everton Wagstaffe and Reginald Connor, who had been convicted of 1992 kidnapping and death of Jennifer Negron; Wagstaffe refused to leave prison on probation, maintaining his innocence for 23 years; panel finds that Brooklyn prosecutors were responsible for 'burying' documents that might have shown that detectives and prime witness had lied in case.
lead_paragraph: Everton Wagstaffe and Reginald Connor, convicted of a 1992 kidnapping, learned that their convictions were overturned by a panel of New York State appeals court judges.

headline.main: After Nearly 23 Years of Legal Struggle, a Conviction Is Reversed
headline.print_headline: After Nearly 23 Years of Legal Struggle, a Conviction Is Reversed
